clinical_study.brief_title: Suicide Prevention by Empowering Adolescents in Pakistan (SEPAK)
clinical_study.official_title: Suicide Prevention by Empowering Adolescents in Pakistan (SEPAK): A Feasibility Study for Research Capability and Trial Readiness in Pakistan

lead_sponsor.agency: Pakistan Institute of Living and Learning

clinical_study.source: Pakistan Institute of Living and Learning

brief_summary.textblock: Self-harm is now seen as an epidemic affecting young people across the world and particularly in low and middle-income countries (LMIC) such as Pakistan. Young people in Pakistan often come across many troubles such as mental health and family problems, stress at school and social and economic inequalities. A youth suicide prevention programme is needed in Pakistan. Such programme will be based on secondary schools (where most young people are) and will support schools to work together with many public agencies to tackle the full range of troubles that young people face. Our main research aim is to work together with multiple stakeholders to culturally adapt and test the feasibility of three SEPAK interventions to prevent suicide among students in secondary schools in Pakistan (aged 12 to 17 years).

Change from baseline to 1-month post baseline
primary_outcome.description: acceptability of the interventions that will be evident from the attendance of participants in each session on a therapy log

secondary_outcome.measure: The Global school-based student health survey (GSHS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in scores from baseline to outcome (1-month post baseline)
secondary_outcome.description: The is a self-administered questionnaire and covered ten key topics: alcohol use, dietary behaviors, drug use, hygiene, mental health, physical activity, protective factors, sexual behaviors, tobacco use, and violence and unintentional injury

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in scores from baseline to outcome (1-month post baseline)
secondary_outcome.description: DSHI will be used to collect information about episode of self-harm. Minimum score is 0 and maximum score is 34. Higher total score indicate the higher intensity of the problem.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in scores from baseline to outcome (1-month post baseline)
secondary_outcome.description: This will use to measure psychological distress. It's a 10 item scale measuring emotional states with a 5 level response scale. Minimum score is 10 and a maximum score is 50. Low scores indicate low levels of psychological distress and high scores indicate high levels of psychological distress.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in scores from baseline to outcome (1-month post baseline)
secondary_outcome.description: This scale is a 19-items instrument that evaluates the presence and intensity of suicidal thoughts in a week. Minimum total score is 0 and maximum total score can be 38. Higher scores indicate worse outcome.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in scores from baseline to outcome (1-month post baseline)
secondary_outcome.description: A standardised instrument to measure health status and associated population utility weights. It consists of a self-report questionnaire covering five dimensions of health (mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/ discomfort and anxiety/ depression)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in scores from baseline to outcome (1-month post baseline)
secondary_outcome.description: We will collect information on the use of health services (including the informal sector such as faith healers/Imams)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Scores reported by the participant on the scale after intervention at 1-month post baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Participant satisfaction with services will be assessed using the Client Satisfaction. The total score ranges from 8 to 32. Higher scores indicate higher level of satisfaction. Questionnaire (CSQ)

arm_group.description: A total of six group sessions with students using presentations and videos.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Question, Persuade, and Refer Plus educational posters
arm_group.description: It is a manualised programme for gatekeepers (teachers). This includes both presentations and videos.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Screening by Professionals programme Plus educational posters
arm_group.description: This is an indicated or selective intervention by health professionals who will review assessments (done using structured questionnaires) and refer students where necessary.
The control group will be exposed to the six educational posters.

intervention.description: This intervention covers depression and its symptoms, the link between depression and suicide, the risk and protective factors associated with suicide, the warning signs of suicide, seeking help and overcoming barriers to seeking help, and school and community suicide prevention resources. Six educational posters will also be displayed in class rooms

intervention.intervention_name: Question, Persuade, and Refer Plus educational posters
intervention.description: It is a manualised programme for gatekeepers, originally developed in the USA which to train teachers/school staff to identify the suicide risk in students and encourage students at risk of suicide to seek professional help. Six educational posters will also be displayed in classrooms.
intervention.arm_group_label: Question, Persuade, and Refer Plus educational posters

intervention.intervention_name: Screening by Professionals programme plus educational posters
intervention.description: This is an indicated or selective intervention which is based on students' responses to the baseline questionnaires. Participating health professionals review students' responses to the questionnaires used in the study and students whose scores meet pre-established cutoff points will be invited to participate in a professional mental health clinical assessment and if needed, referred to clinical services. Six educational posters will also be displayed in classrooms.
intervention.arm_group_label: Screening by Professionals programme Plus educational posters

intervention.description: Six educational posters will be displayed in all schools in this cluster.
